snippet: A collection of photographs belonging to Mary Berg, a diarist of the Warsaw Ghetto, were saved from public auction and were bought by the Holocaust museum in Washington.
abstract: Five albums once belonging to the teenage Holocaust diarist Mary Berg have been acquired by United States Holocaust Memorial Museum in Washington; sale brings closure to episode that raised concerns over ethics of selling Holocaust-related material on open market.
lead_paragraph: A collection of photographs belonging to Mary Berg, a diarist of the Warsaw Ghetto, were saved from public auction and were bought by the Holocaust museum in Washington.
